Interactive Team

T.J. VanSlyke

Introductions

Say a word about your wonderful selves, why don't you?

The Rules

Respect
Treat your fellow students and I with the respect with which you would wish to be treated yourself.
Honesty
Display honesty when completing in-class assignments and work outside of class.
Constructivism
This class is about creating. Please refrain from making destructive comments about others' work, but do not hesitate to criticize others' work if it could benefit them.

Organization

Part One: Business

Discovery
Topics related to initial interactions with a potential client.
Definition
Topics related to the broad definition of an interactive product, including drafting a statement of definition.
Design
Create wireframes and mockups which demonstrate expected behavior. Provide clients with multiple options upfront.
Development
Develop a working site to the decided specifications on an incremental schedule.
Delivery
How to deliver a working site frequently and incrementally.

Organization

Part Two: Technical

HTML
Our conduit of content on the web.
CSS
Our conduit of style on the web.
Git
Our version control system.
Jekyll
Our content management solution.
Basecamp
Our project collaboration tool.

Discovery

Finding potential clients



Request For Proposal (RFP)
From Wikipedia: A request for proposal (referred to as RFP) is an invitation for suppliers, often through a bidding process, to submit a proposal on a specific commodity or service.

Reading an RFP

Things to watch for

Fixed-bid versus hourly bidding
Organizations offering RFP's will undoubtedly prefer fixed-bid arrangements since they will have a guaranteed price.
Do the offering organization's values align with your organization's values?
Any creative endeavor is doomed to turn sour without a legitimate alignment of values.

Lab

Create your class blog using Jekyll

Requirements:

  • Ruby
  • Rubygems
  • Jekyll
  • A text editor of your choice

Assignment

a.k.a. "You mean we have to take this class home?!"



  • Read the assigned example RFP
  • Come to class prepared to discuss it
